s0312.literal: If you dam up their mouths, how long can it last?'
s0312.idiomatic: If you dam up their mouths, how long can it last?'

s0314.chinese: 於是國莫敢出言，三年，乃相與畔，襲厲王。
s0314.literal: Thus no one in the state dared to speak out. After three years, they united in rebellion and attacked King Li.
s0314.idiomatic: Thus no one in the state dared to speak out. After three years, they united in rebellion and attacked King Li.

s0316.chinese: 厲王太子靜匿召公之家，國人聞之，乃圍之。
s0316.literal: King Li's crown prince Jing hid in Shao Gong's house. The people of the capital heard of it and surrounded it.
s0316.idiomatic: King Li's crown prince Jing hid in Shao Gong's house. The people of the capital heard of it and surrounded it.

s0317.chinese: 召公曰：「昔吾驟諫王，王不從，以及此難也。
s0317.literal: Shao Gong said: 'Formerly I repeatedly advised the king, but the king did not listen, and thus we have come to this disaster.
s0317.idiomatic: Shao Gong said: 'Formerly I repeatedly advised the king, but the king did not listen, and thus we have come to this disaster.

s0318.chinese: 今殺王太子，王其以我為讎而懟怒乎？
s0318.literal: Now if we kill the king's crown prince, will the king consider me an enemy and be resentful and angry?
s0318.idiomatic: Now if we kill the king's crown prince, will the king consider me an enemy and be resentful and angry?

s0319.chinese: 夫事君者，險而不讎懟，怨而不怒，況事王乎！」
s0319.literal: Those who serve a lord face danger without becoming enemies or resentful, harbor resentment without anger, how much more so when serving a king!'
s0319.idiomatic: Those who serve a lord face danger without becoming enemies or resentful, harbor resentment without anger, how much more so when serving a king!'

s0320.chinese: 乃以其子代王太子，太子竟得脫。
s0320.literal: Thus he substituted his own son for the king's crown prince, and the crown prince ultimately escaped.
s0320.idiomatic: Thus he substituted his own son for the king's crown prince, and the crown prince ultimately escaped.

s0321.chinese: 召公、周公二相行政，號曰「共和」。
s0321.literal: Shao Gong and Zhou Gong, the two prime ministers, administered the government, called it 'Gonghe.'
s0321.idiomatic: Shao Gong and Zhou Gong, the two prime ministers, administered the government, called it 'Gonghe.'

s0322.chinese: 共和十四年，厲王死于彘。
s0322.literal: In the fourteenth year of Gonghe, King Li died at Zhi.
s0322.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year of Gonghe, King Li died at Zhi.

s0323.chinese: 太子靜長於召公家，二相乃共立之為王，是為宣王。
s0323.literal: Crown prince Jing grew up in Shao Gong's house, and the two prime ministers together established him as king, known as King Xuan.
s0323.idiomatic: Crown prince Jing grew up in Shao Gong's house, and the two prime ministers together established him as king, known as King Xuan.

s0324.chinese: 宣王即位，二相輔之，修政，法文、武、成、康之遺風，諸侯復宗周。
s0324.literal: King Xuan ascended the throne, the two prime ministers assisted him, reformed the government, followed the legacy of King Wen, King Wu, King Cheng, and King Kang, and the feudal lords again took Zhou as their center.
s0324.idiomatic: King Xuan ascended the throne, the two prime ministers assisted him, reformed the government, followed the legacy of King Wen, King Wu, King Cheng, and King Kang, and the feudal lords again took Zhou as their center.

s0325.literal: In the twelfth year, Lu Wu Gong came to court.
s0325.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Lu Wu Gong came to court.

s0326.chinese: 宣王不修籍於千畝，虢文公諫曰不可，王弗聽。
s0326.literal: King Xuan did not repair the boundaries at Qianmu. Guo Wen Gong advised that it was not permissible, but the king did not listen.
s0326.idiomatic: King Xuan did not repair the boundaries at Qianmu. Guo Wen Gong advised that it was not permissible, but the king did not listen.

s0327.chinese: 三十九年，戰于千畝，王師敗績于姜氏之戎。
s0327.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, he fought at Qianmu, and the king's army suffered a great defeat at the hands of the Jiang Rong.
s0327.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, he fought at Qianmu, and the king's army suffered a great defeat at the hands of the Jiang Rong.

s0328.chinese: 宣王既亡南國之師，乃料民於太原。
s0328.literal: After King Xuan lost the army of the southern states, he took a census of the people at Taiyuan.
s0328.idiomatic: After King Xuan lost the army of the southern states, he took a census of the people at Taiyuan.

s0329.chinese: 仲山甫諫曰：「民不可料也。」
s0329.literal: Zhong Shanfu advised: 'The people cannot be counted.'
s0329.idiomatic: Zhong Shanfu advised: 'The people cannot be counted.'

s0330.literal: King Xuan did not listen, and ultimately took the census of the people.
s0330.idiomatic: King Xuan did not listen, and ultimately took the census of the people.

s0331.chinese: 四十六年，宣王崩，子幽王宮湦立。
s0331.literal: In the forty-sixth year, King Xuan died, his son King You Gong Shen ascended.
s0331.idiomatic: In the forty-sixth year, King Xuan died, his son King You Gong Shen ascended.
